titleStmt.title: Commonswealth of Kentucky v. Jack (A Slave), Indictment
CWG6698

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Cumberland Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky Plff
vs' } Indictment for Arson,
Jack a Slave Deft

It appearing that Asa Elliott has been duly Summoned to answer for the forfeiture of the bail Bond executed in this prosecution, and he failing to answer, it is therefore ordered and adjudged by the Court that Plff recover of Said Deft Elliott the Sum of Two Hundred and Fifty dollars and the costs herein expended and Execution may issue &c
I J. M. Boles clerk of the Cumberland circuit court certify that the above is a true copy of a Judgement rendered in Said court at its April Term 1865.

Comwlth Plff
v } copy Ind.
Asa Elliott
